reviews.text: We stayed in 203B (townhouse), and were very pleased. It had a king suite and a queen suite, which was great for 2 couples. Clean, quiet, and nicely appointed. We did sit through the 2-hour time share spiel, but got a free breakfast out of it (part of the 2 hours), and there was no undue pressure after we said "no." (And they offered several options of gifts after the presentation, including Busch Gardens or Williamsburg tickets.) The unit was very clean and well-stocked, even though it was slated for an update. We would recommend the place to anyone. King's Creek is right next door to the Water Park, and within a 15-minute drive of Williamsburg, Jamestown, Yorktown, Williamsburg Winery, and more.
reviews.title: Great stay, very pleased.

reviews.text: I booked a weeks stay at King's Creek Plantation through a phone solicitation and when I was unable to make it and gave them 5 months notice of my cancellation they refused to refund my money. I then asked if I could use it another time and they said yes. When I called back a year later to use the $1491.27 they had charged to my credit card I was told " that I was not welcome at the resort and to have a nice day." I kid you not. They have basically stolen $1491.27 from my family refused to refund it even though they were give 5 months notice and it has been the rudest resort that I have ever dealt with. The condos are nice and roomy but if you run into any situation where you have to cancel you will not get your money back no matter how much notice is given. Be very wary! This seems incredibly unprofessional and actually borders on being illegal. I guess Virginia has different laws.
reviews.title: Be very wary!
Great stay
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nites in a one bedroom cottage and had a wonderful experience. We were on the first floor and had little noise from upstairs unit. Unit was clean, good size and well stocked kitchen. We tried the jacuzzi which worked well. Deck off the kitchen was a nice touch. There was not pressure from sales staff for timeshare promo. The indoor pool and locker rooms were well maintained. The grounds were neat with maintenance staff always in sight grooming the facility. I would definately return. The location is easily accessible to everything. Just 5 miles to Colonial Williamsburg & quick access to golf. Check out their big discounts to local courses. A great stay

reviews.title: fantastic vacation spot
reviews.text: This is an excellent vacation resort. The cottages were more than we expected. The fitness center and aquatics center are first class. We used the pool, fitness and locker rooms at least once daily. So convenient. The staff was always super pleasant.
Gayle and John B at the conceirge desk always had great ideas for food, dining and events.
reviews.title: not exactly what we expected

likes.liked: — Size of the unit, full kitchen, washer/dryer, home away from home, close to things to do

reviews.text: Had a great Williamsburg vacation, and will not let Kings Creek ruin that for us, but there were some major problems that no one seemed to address. We are actually in the time share buying market, and thought we would take the opportunity to tour the property. Our room was already pre-paid through Expedia, however, so we asked what compensation was available if the room was pre-paid. (They had been offering discounts off your stay). We were told at least three times in the last few months that we would receive a check (that we could cash anywhere! - their words!) upon completion of tour. Nothing was ever in writing, but we had talked several times to Louis. You can guess what happens next- no one has a record that we are to receive a check, and they say they do not do that. The irony in all of this is that we are actually buyers, as opposed to the people who are there for a free vacation and a cheap one time trip. If they treat the owners like this, who would want to buy there? After speaking with at least three rude people at the desk to try to clear up the confusion, we refused the tour, since they said we could take it, but would receive no compensation. The next day, I went back to use the wireless, (very inconvenient set-up) and the lady at the desk lied again, right to me, and told me I didn't give her a chance to check the computer. After 30 minutes of asking me who I talked to, and did I have it in writing, she could have suggested that she would check the computer. Enough about the time share presentation, we definitely decided to look/buy elsewhere.
reviews.title: Look Elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was not available until right at time. You could not request a certain unit, it was pre-assigned. We stayed in the Townes, which was chosen because it was close to the pool. It is a one floor plan, with an extra sunroom, that we used as a bedroom for our son, since it had a pull out couch. But we had an outside streetlight right out the window of daughter's bedroom, that shone quite brightly through the night right into her window. No way to block the light, so she moved to the living room and slept on couch, which made her bedroom useless. Parking is hard during the day there because everyone drives down to use the pool, and they used the spaces in front of our condo everyday. So we usually were walking with lots of stuff. Whirlpool tub in master bath did not work. Pools are not monitored, and tons of kids are in the adult pool with no supervision. There is no miniature golf, wireless in all units (as I heard timeshare salesmen tell people). For what we paid, we could have gotten two hotel rooms right in WIlliamsburg, so the value was not that great. Unit was in poor shape - even though they claim that the Townes is the newer section. Very beat up walls, moldy, cracked shower tiles. No security guard at gate, tons of people were just driving in to use their pools. WIlliamsburg is a beautiful area, and there are other, much nicer time share properties where you will feel valued, so check in to those also.
reviews.title: Weekend getaway to Williamsburg and Kings Creek Plantation

likes.disliked: — The room was outdated and upkeep was lacking

reviews.text: We went to a travel show this past February in Baltimore. King's Creek Plantation was there talking about their timeshare and trying to get people to "tour" their property. We took the information home and decided to call a few weeks ago. My girlfriend thought this would be a nice weekend away for the 2 of us.
reviews.title: Loved It! Definitely will return!

likes.liked: — Spacious 2-bedroom units and close location to theme parks and historical areas
likes.disliked: — No wireless internet and no option to plug in for high speed internet from the unit

reviews.text: There are 3 sections here:
reviews.title: Never will go back

likes.liked: — Being right next door to Water Country USA
likes.disliked: — The sound of the smoke detector!!!

reviews.text: The cottages (about 10 years old)
reviews.title: Great for kids, great location
Most things were great, but had limited Internet access
reviews.text: We stayed in the Townes (condo) section of the facility. Our two-bedroom unit was generously sized, and in very good condition, even though the unit is scheduled for renovation. The floors were creaky from settling, and the floor tiles had some cracks, but everything worked and we had plenty of room to get comfortable. The full-sized refrigerator and stove/oven/dishwasher were great - we are vegetarian so we cooked in the unit several times. The two problems were the LIMITED access to an Internet connection, and the bed in the master bedroom. The resort's wi-fi network was only available in the Clubhouse, and only during business hours (8am-5pm). They have Internet-capable computers in the gift shop but the gift shop also has limited hours. The bed in the master bedrom was firm, which we like, but the mattress was obviously of low quality because we could easily hear the springs creaking when we moved. If it weren't for the lack of full Internet access, we would happily stay here again, though. Hopefully if we make another trip to the Williamsburg area in the future, this facility will have remedied both f these problems.

My brother, sister-in-law and myself just came back from a weeks stay (5-30 tru 6-6-08). I traded my timeshare week and we stayed in the cottages, 103A. We flew in to Dulles Airport so it was a bit of a drive to the resort. We were a little early but we were able to check in immediately. I had emailed the resort a few weeks before asking for a non-smoking cottage away from construction and pool (we're older and wanted quiet). The resort replied and said it was a 1st come basis. When we got there we again asked for a cottage away from it all and they had honored our request. It was an easy and enjoyable check in. We had a 2 bedroom cottage for the 3 of us -- lots of room! We each had a bathroom attached to our room with a 1/2 half on the main level. The unit was showing some wear and tear (they were working on updating it), with scuff marks on the walls and the flooring in the kitchen by the fridge was coming loose, but otherwise it was a very nice unit. Very clean and wth all the ammenities we needed. We ate most of our a.m. and p.m. meals in our unit. You do have to share grills (which could be cleaned more often). The outdoor pool was very nice and we made use of it since it was unusuallly hot when we were there. The staff was nice and helpful. There were 3 internet sites in the gift shop and the wait could be long (no pre-sign up for use--you just had to wait in line). We spent most of our time out sightseeing so we didn't take advantage of activitites at the resort. I would highly recommend this resort. One of the nices and roomiest units we have stayed in.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay

likes.liked: — The cottage had lots of room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in Williamsburg from May 15-19. This hotel was nice, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The grounds are immaculate. There is quite a bit of construction going on in the front of the resort where they are building new cottages that look amazing. We stayed in a 1 bedroom cottage. It was in dire need of upgrading (the carpet was green and furniture was dated). The TVs in the unit were about 13" each and we could barely see it from the couch. The kitchen was small but adequate for our purposes. It is fully stocked with all necessary utensils, bowls, wine glasses etc. There is a stove, oven, and fridge. There is NO cleaning service at this resort. They ask that you do all your dishes before you leave. The pool area was nice and quiet. The hot tubs seemed dirty (I didn't venture in). DON'T trust the concierge here. I called for a recommendation of a fancy seafood restaurant in Williamsburg. When we got to the location we were way overdressed. The concierge recommended the equivalent of a Red Lobster for a fancy restaurant. Overall, I would stay here if you got a really good deal (we stayed for free from a promotional offer). If you are still debating I would recommend Kingsmill Resort... its beautiful and more of the full service resort that some may be used to.
reviews.title: Average Resort--cottages need upgrading

reviews.text: We stayed here about four years ago and I must say it was immaculate. I have no complaints what so ever. We stayed for free as part of a sales pitch. When they found out we were already timeshare owners elsewhere, they upgraded our room. We did not purchase there and I don't remember being pressured at all to do so. There was free miniature golf and the pools were great. If I travel to Williamsburg again, I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

likes.liked: — The units were in perfect condition and it was FREE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is being written as we head back home from our vacation at Kings Creek Plantation, Williamsburg, VA. We were not sure what to expect, because when we booked at this resort through RCI points it was rated a GOLD CROWN resort. However, it is now rated a SILVER Crown.
reviews.title: Nice Resort Fantastic Location

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and how well the grounds are maintained

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a weeks stay at Kings Creek Plantation. We booked a 2 bedroom in the Townes Section. The front desk people were extremely friendly and checked us in right away. They also offered directions to local restaurants and attractions for us.
reviews.title: Very Clean and Terrific Space Great Location

likes.liked: — How spacious and clean the unit was.

reviews.title: Hate This Resort - Especially Paula At The Clubhouse!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: The 2 bedroom was extremely clean and spacious. We were surprised, however, because we thought it was like the pictures you see on the internet with the staircase. The Townes section is actually all on one floor. There are 2 bedrooms..one with a queen, one with a king, 2 full baths...one with large jetted tub. There are also 2 living rooms. They call one a "sunroom", but it isn't. It is a second living room attached to the master bedroom. Full kitchen with all necessesities as well. If you are staying "in season", I would recommend a top floor unit because it would be extremely noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like that they provided toilet paper, soap and paper towels. Some timeshares don't.
reviews.title: Excellent in most ways

reviews.text: We were extremely disappointed, however, because the main "aquatics center" did not seem to be working at all. The pool was open, but freezing with no heat. The hot tub was lukewarm with no jets working. The womans' steam room was also broken. Since we picked this place specifically based on these facilities, we were very disappointed. Management didn't seem to care and did not offer any compensation which I think they should. I can understand things breaking down for a day or two. But a week? For a complex this size they should have maintenance people onsite to handle this. Especially because they make a big deal out of promoting their "aquatics center". We were told they needed to get the plumber to come fix it. What is that? They also told us the same thing happened about a week before we were there.
reviews.title: loved it..

likes.liked: — the rooms, it makes you feel right at home and the fire place..
likes.disliked: — the least supply of towels, and housekeeping{theres non}, n its not lik a hotel

reviews.text: Overall a good value, but this was very disappointing and frustrating that no one cared enough to either apologize or offer some sort of compensation.
reviews.title: Disappointed, this development is not being maintained

likes.disliked: — Poor quality, no one tending to a critical matter, no refund or new assignment!
